summary: Admin Access system must validate a permanent five-character master access code (7583A) to grant admin access and redirect to the full Admin Dashboard with all tools enabled.
architectural_notes: Admin Access page must recognize master code '7583A' and, when entered exactly, immediately display 'Access Granted' and auto-redirect to Admin Dashboard with full admin permissions enabled.

existing_features.title: Update the Admin Access page so that when the user enters "7583A" it immediately shows the success message "Access Granted" and automatically redirects to "/admin" without ever displaying an access-denied state for that exact input.

Update admin settings UI copy so it does not imply that the permanent master code can be changed; clearly present 7583A as the permanent master code and treat the existing update form as changing only the configurable admin access code.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement permanent master admin access code '7583A' that always grants access, shows 'Access Granted', and redirects to full Admin Dashboard with all admin tools enabled.

Ensure the backend permanently recognizes the master admin access code "7583A" and always returns "Access Granted" when the caller submits exactly that code, regardless of any prior lockout state or configurable code changes.

Normalize admin access code validation on the backend so that the permanent master code check for "7583A" is robust to common user input variations (leading/trailing spaces and case differences), while still treating the code as exactly five characters after trimming.

projectName: Make 7583A a permanent master admin code that always grants access and redirects to Admin Dashboard
